death_moments: The cold reaches your chest. Your legs stop working. The water rises, or maybe you sink. It's hard to tell the difference now.
You fall. The stone is cold against your cheek. Somewhere above, light flickers. You won't reach it.
Darkness crowds the edges of your vision. The last thing you see is the ceiling, impossibly far away.
Your weapon slips from numb fingers. The sound of it hitting stone is the last thing you hear.
Pain fades to numbness. Numbness fades to cold. Cold fades to nothing. This is what nothing feels like.
The creature watches you fall. There's something like pity in its eyes. Or hunger. Hard to tell the difference now.
You always wondered how it would end. Now you know. It ends like this. On cold stone. In dark water.
Your thoughts scatter like startled birds. One remains, clear and final: this is it. This is how your story ends.
The underworld catches you as you fall. It's been waiting for this. It's always been waiting for this.
Everything becomes distant — the pain, the cold, the fear. Peace, almost. Almost like peace.
You try to move. Your body disagrees. The argument is over before it begins. The body wins. The body always wins.
Blood or water. You can't tell which is filling your lungs. Does it matter? Does anything matter now?
The last breath leaves you. It doesn't come back. This is the part they don't tell you about: the quiet.
You reach for something — hope, help, another chance. Your hand closes on nothing. Nothing is all that's left.
The world tilts. Spins. Stops. This is what stopping feels like. This is what endings taste like.
Somewhere, someone might remember you. Here, the walls will remember. The water will remember. The dark always remembers.
You fought. You tried. It wasn't enough. It's never enough. The underworld accepts all debts, all dreams, all deaths.
The creature moves on. You were a moment in its eternal existence. A meal. A memory. A message.
Consciousness thins like morning mist. What lies beyond it? You're about to find out. You're about to become part of the answer.
This deep, death is just a change of address. You lived above. Now you live here. Forever here.
final_words_intros: Your last thought crystallizes. Something for those who follow. A warning? A joke? A prayer?
With what remains of your strength, you leave a message. Let it mean something. Let it matter.
Words form in the dark. Final words. The only thing you'll leave behind.
One thought survives the fall. One message. Make it count.
The wall is cold beneath your fingers. You trace letters. These letters will outlast you.
You scratch into stone what you wish you could shout to the world: a last declaration.
Before the dark takes everything, you give it something: words. Your words. Forever.
The dying write to the living. It's the oldest tradition. The most honest communication.
What do you say when there's nothing left to say? You say this:
A message in a bottle. Except the bottle is stone and the ocean is time.
corpse_discovery_outros: They tried. They failed. But they left something behind.
Another soul, another story, another warning.
The underworld is full of endings. This is one of them.
Whoever they were, they mattered. Their words prove it.
Every corpse was once hope. Every message was once breath.
They came seeking fortune. They found this instead.
The dead teach the living. This is the oldest school.
Someone loved them once. Someone might remember them still.
A life, reduced to a message. A message, preserved in stone.
They didn't make it. You still can. That's why they wrote.
